titles.title: OIRA Insight, Reform, and Accountability Act

To amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations, and for other purposes Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,.
OIRA Insight, Reform, and Accountability Act

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Antitrust, Commercial, and Administrative Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Administrative State, Regulatory Reform, and Antitrust

bill.summary:
OIRA Insight, Reform, and Accountability Act
This bill provides statutory authority for and revises requirements concerning the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs' review of significant regulatory actions.
